p: Bemisia tabaci has been defined as a complex of a possible 28 morphologically indistinguishable “cryptic” species, however, it has been demonstrated that there is even greater complexity [ 3– 4]. Bemisia tabaci consists of a sibling species group and haplotypes based on mitochondrial DNA and some of the well-known haplotypes, MEAM1 (Middle East-Asia Minor 1 species) and MED (Mediterranean species), showing moderate to high levels of genetic diversity.
